sen.j: 福知山市（ふくちやまし）は、京都府北部（旧丹波国）の丹波地方に位置する京都府下で2番目に出来た市である。
sen.e: Fukuchiyama City is the second oldest city in Kyoto Prefecture and is located in the Tanba region in the northern part (old Tanba Province) of Kyoto Prefecture.
Fukuchiyama City is the second oldest city in Kyoto Prefecture and is located in the Tanba region in the northern part (old Tanba Province) of Kyoto Prefecture.
Fukuchiyama City is the second oldest city in Kyoto Prefecture and is located in the Tanba region in the northern part (old Tanba Province) of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 福知山市を含む周辺地域では縄文時代の始め頃から人が住んでいたといわれ、広範囲において数多くの古墳やその住居跡が出土したことから、かつては多数の有力豪族が居たと考えられている。
sen.e: It is said that people lived in the surrounding area including Fukuchiyama City from the beginning of the Jomon Period, and it is considered that many influential powerful families used to be there because many ancient tombs and their dwelling sites were found in the wide ranging areas.

It is said that people lived in the surrounding area including Fukuchiyama City from the beginning of the Jomon Period. Many influential powerful families are thought to have lived here because many ancient tombs and dwellings were found across a wide area.

It is said that people lived in the surrounding area including Fukuchiyama City from the beginning of the Jomon period; many influential powerful families are thought to have lived here because many ancient tombs and dwellings were found across a wide area.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: それ以降は土地のほとんどが荘園として利用されたため主だった中心地はなかったが、戦国時代 (日本)になると丹波平定の命を受けた明智光秀が塩見信房を倒し、その居城であった横山城を大修築し近世型の福智山城（後の福知山城）とした。
sen.e: A central place was not established because most lands were used as manors thereafter, but in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), Mitsuhide AKECHI who was ordered to territorialize Tanba defeated Nobufusa SHIOMI, and established the modern-style Fukuchiyama-jo Castle after repairing the Yokoyama-jo Castle which was Shiomi's dwelling castle.

A central place was not established because most lands were used as manors thereafter, but in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), Mitsuhide AKECHI who was ordered to territorialize Tanba defeated Nobufusa SHIOMI, and established the modern-style Fukuchiyama-jo Castle after repairing the Yokoyama-jo Castle which was the castle where Shiomi dwelled.

A central place was not established because most lands were used as manors thereafter, but in the Sengoku period (period of Warring States), Mitsuhide AKECHI who was ordered to territorialize Tanba defeated Nobufusa SHIOMI, and established the modern-style Fukuchiyama-jo Castle (福智山城, later written as 福知山城) after repairing the Yokoyama-jo Castle which was the castle where Shiomi dwelled.

sen.j: 福知山は後にその城下町として発展を遂げた都市である。
sen.e: Thereafter, Fukuchiyama has developed as its castle town.
Thereafter, Fukuchiyama developed into a castle town.
Thereafter, Fukuchiyama developed into a castle town.

sen.j: 光秀はたびたび大氾濫を起こしていた由良川の治水に成功し、現在もなお行われている築堤工事は彼に始まる治水事業の歴史を連綿と受け継ぐものである。
sen.e: Mitsuhide succeeded in flood prevention works of Yura-gawa River which often caused heavy flood damage, and embankment works still under construction come down from the history of his flood prevention works without interruption.

Mitsuhide was successful in executing flood prevention for the Yura-gawa River, which often caused heavy flood damage. Today, similar work continues uninterrupted, continuing the history of his flood prevention works.

Mitsuhide was successful in executing flood prevention for the Yura-gawa River, which often caused heavy flood damage; today, similar work continues uninterrupted, continuing the history of his flood prevention works.
sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。

sen.j: 光秀はそれに加え地子銭を免除するなどの善政を敷いたことから、その治世がわずかであったにもかかわらず後には御霊神社 (福知山市)に祀られ市の花も明智氏の家紋であるキキョウとするなど、福知山における光秀への信望はあつい。
sen.e: In addition to that, by reason of giving good administration including exemption from Shishisen tax, etc., Mitsuhide is eminently respectable in Fukuchiyama even though the length of his reign was short, as shown by the facts that he was enshrined in Goryo-jinja Shrine (Fukuchiyama City) later, Japanese bellflower used as a family emblem of the Akechi clan is also designated as a flower of the City, etc.

Additionally, due to his favorable administration which included exemption from Shishisen tax, etc., Mitsuhide is extremely respected in Fukuchiyama even though the length of his reign was short, as shown by his enshrinement in Goryo-jinja Shrine (Fukuchiyama City). Later, the Japanese bellflower, which was used as a family emblem of the Akechi clan, was also designated as the City flower, etc.

Additionally, due to his favorable administration which included exemption from Jishisen tax (land tax), etc., Mitsuhide is extremely respected in Fukuchiyama even though the length of his reign was short, as shown by his enshrinement in Goryo-jinja Shrine (Fukuchiyama City); later, the Japanese bellflower, which was used as a family emblem of the Akechi clan, was also designated as the City flower, etc.
sen.cmt: Jishisen とし、説明を追加しました。

sen.j: 明治時代に入ると日露戦争を控え、京阪神と日本有数の軍港である舞鶴港とをつなぐ交通網の普及が急がれた理由から、福知山はその中継地点として軍用鉄道の福知山線の整備がなされた。
sen.e: In the Meiji Period, by reason that the expansion of transportation network connecting Keihanshin and Maizuru Port which was one of the major military ports in Japan was an urgent issue in preparation for the Russo-Japanese War, the Fukuchiyama Line used as a military railroad was improved with setting Fukuchiyama as a connecting point.

During the Meiji Period, the Fukuchiyama Line, which was used as a military railroad, was improved by setting Fukuchiyama as a connecting point. This was carried out due to the fact that expanding the transportation network connecting Keihanshin and Maizuru Port, which was one of the major military ports in Japan, was seen as an urgent issue in preparation for the Russo-Japanese War.

During the Meiji period, the Fukuchiyama Line, which was used as a military railroad, was improved by setting Fukuchiyama as a connecting point; this was carried out due to the fact that expanding the transportation network connecting Keihanshin (Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe area) and Maizuru Port, which was one of the major military ports in Japan, was seen as an urgent issue in preparation for the Russo-Japanese War.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。京阪神の補足をしました。

sen.j: 更にその11年後には山陰本線も整備され、県庁所在地以外としては珍しく鉄道管理局が置かれたことなどもあって福知山は「鉄道のまち」として栄えた。
sen.e: Moreover, since the Sanin Main Line was improved 11 years after that, and the Railroad Administration was established in Fukuchiyama City rarely for a city other than prefectural capitals, Fukuchiyama was flourished as a 'city of railroad.'

Moreover, Fukuchiyama flourished as a 'Railroad City' due to several factors: The Sanin Main Line was upgraded 11 years after and the establishment of the Railroad Administration in Fukuchiyama City, a rare event to occur besides prefectural capitals

Moreover, Fukuchiyama flourished as a 'Railroad City' due to several factors: The Sanin Main Line was upgraded eleven years after and the Railroad Administration was established in Fukuchiyama City, a rare event to occur besides prefectural capitals.
sen.cmt: 文章を補足しました。数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）ごろからは遅れていた高速道路も整備も成され、その交通の利便性などから拠点を置く多数の大手企業が存在し、それらは福知山都市圏を構成し福知山市はその中心を担う。
sen.e: From around 1987, the delayed improvement of expressways has started, many major companies locating their bases in Fukuchiyama by reason of convenient transportation have existed and constituted the Fukuchiyama urban area, and Fukuchiyama has been playing its central part.

From around 1987, the delayed improvement of expressways has started. Many major companies are located in Fukuchiyama due to the convenient transportation. These companies comprise the urban area of Fukuchiyama, centered around Fukuchiyama City.

From around 1987, the delayed improvement of expressways has started; many major companies are located in Fukuchiyama due to the convenient transportation and these companies comprise the urban area of Fukuchiyama, centered around Fukuchiyama City.
sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。

sen.j: 一方特産品の藍染め品や藍染品などのさまざまな農産品を生産し、それらを扱う商いのまちとして栄えてきた福知山は、後継者不足などの問題によりそれらの産業は衰退しほぼ完全に消滅してしまった。
sen.e: On the other hand, Fukuchiyama where specialty goods and various agricultural products such as indigo-dyeing products were produced has been flourished as a commercial city dealing with those goods and products, but those industries declined due to shortage of successors and disappeared almost completely.

On the other hand, while Fukuchiyama used to flourish in the production of specialty goods and various agricultural products such as indigo-dyeing, such industries have declined over time due to a shortage of successors and have disappeared almost completely.

On the other hand, while Fukuchiyama used to flourish in the production of specialty goods and various agricultural products such as indigo-dyeing, such industries have declined over time due to a shortage of successors and have disappeared almost completely.

sen.j: 現状としては内陸型工業団地としては比較的大規模な長田野工業団地が高度経済成長を経た1974年（昭和49年）に整備着手がなされたことによる、工業や商業が主な福知山の産業になっているが、それらのかつての伝統と歴史を復活させようと総合的な学習の時間で学ばせる教育機関や、そういった活動の趣旨の民間団体が結成されるなどの動きも見られる。
sen.e: The current situation is that industries and commerce are the main industry of Fukuchiyama because the development of Osadano Industrial Park which is comparatively large as an inland industrial park has started in 1974 after the rapid economic growth, but there are some movements that educational institutions teaching former traditions and history in the comprehensive learning are established to revive those, and that private organizations aiming to conduct such activities are formed.

Currently heavy industries and commerce are the main industries of Fukuchiyama due to the development of Osadano Industrial Park (comparatively large is inland industrial parks go), which started in 1974 after the rapid economic growth. The development of this park has spawned some movements by educational institutions implement a comprehensive curriculum to teach former traditions and history, together with the formation of private organizations which aim to carry out such activities.

Currently heavy industries and commerce are the main industries of Fukuchiyama due to the development of Osadano Industrial Park (comparatively large inland industrial parks), which started in 1974 after the rapid economic growth; the development of this park has spawned some movements by educational institutions to implement a comprehensive curriculum to teach former traditions and history, together with the formation of private organizations which aim to carry out such activities.

sen.j: 現在の福知山市章は、1938年（昭和13年）12月に公募により二千点近くの中から選ばれ制定されたもので、「ふくちやま」の頭文字である「ふ」をカタカナにし、それを九つ並べて図案化されたものであり、その図案はフ九」つまり「福」をこの市章は表している。
sen.e: The current city symbol of Fukuchiyama that was chosen from about 2,000 entries from across Japan and was established in 1938 is designed by laying side-by-side 9 katakana characters of 'Fu,' initial letter of 'Fukuchiyama,' and this design of city emblem expresses 'Fuku' with 'nine Fu' pronounced as 'Fuku.'

The current city symbol of Fukuchiyama was chosen from about 2,000 entries from across Japan and was established in 1938. It was designed by laying side-by-side the 9 katakana characters of 'Fu,' the initial letter of 'Fukuchiyama.' This design expresses 'Fuku' with the 'nine Fu' pronounced as 'Fuku.'

The current city symbol of Fukuchiyama was chosen from about 2,000 entries from across Japan and was established in 1938; it was designed by laying side-by-side the nine katakana characters of 'Fu,' the initial letter of 'Fukuchiyama'; this design expresses 'Fuku' (good luck) with the 'nine Fu' pronounced as 'Fuku.'
sen.cmt: Fuku の説明としてgood luck と補足しました。

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年）に制定された福岡市の市章も同様の理由でカタカナの「フ」を九つ並べて図案化されており、その点に関しては共通点があるといえる。
sen.e: The city emblem of Fukuoka established in 1967 is also designed by laying 9 katakana characters of 'Fu' by the same reason, and has in common in terms of this point.
The city emblem of Fukuoka established in 1967 was also designed by laying the 9 katakana characters of 'Fu' side by side.
The city emblem of Fukuoka established in 1967 was also designed by laying the nine katakana characters of 'Fu' side by side, therefore the two cities have this point in common.

sen.j: 室町時代後期になると、小笠原氏の小笠原長清の末裔とされる小笠原頼勝は、福知山盆地の中央部に位置する「横山」と呼ばれた丘陵地に簡素な空堀と土塁だけで出来た福知山城を築きあげた。
sen.e: In the latter half of Muromachi Period, Yorikatsu OGASAWARA who is considered to be a scion of Nagakiyo OGASAWARA in the Ogasawara clan built the simple Fukuchiyama-jo Castle only with an empty moat and earthworks in the hilly area called 'Yokoyama' located in the central part of Fukuchiyama Basin.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)に入ると、塩見頼氏は子の塩見信房に横山城を譲り、彼が福知山を統治するようになる。
sen.e: In the Sengoku Period, Nobufusa SHIOMI, son of Yoriuji SHIOMI, took over the Yokoyama-jo Castle from his father, and ruled Fukuchiyama.

sen.j: しかし1579年（天正7年）8月に織田信長に丹波平定を命ぜられた明智光秀は横山城を攻め落とし、城主の塩見信房は自害し果て、塩見氏の福知山統治は終焉することになる。
sen.e: However, Mitsuhide AKECHI who was ordered by Nobunaga ODA to territorialize Tanba conquered the Yokoyama-jo Castle in August 1579, and Nobufusa SHIOMI, its castellan, killed himself, which brought about the end of ruling Fukuchiyama by the Shiomi clan.

However, Mitsuhide AKECHI who was ordered by Nobunaga ODA to take over Tanba conquered Yokoyama-jo Castle in August 1579, and Nobufusa SHIOMI, its steward, killed himself, which brought about the end of the rule of Fukuchiyama under the Shiomi clan.

sen.j: 光秀は褒章として丹波の国を与えられ、同時にこの城を城代に命じて大改修を行った。
sen.e: Mitsuhide received Tanba Province in appreciation, and ordered a castle keeper to undergo a large-scale renovation of this castle simultaneously.
In appreciation, Mitsuhide received Tanba Province, and subsequently ordered a castle keeper to simultaneously carry out large scale renovations of the castle.

sen.j: 光秀はこの改修後の城を「福智山城」と改め、ここに福知山の地名が誕生する。
sen.e: Mitsuhide changed the name of this castle to 'Fukuchiyama-jo Castle' after this renovation, and the place name of Fukuchiyama was born.

sen.j: 更に光秀はそれまでたびたび氾濫を起こしていた由良川の流れを改善し、度重なる洪水によって疲弊していた農民に対し地子銭を免除するなど善政を敷き、城下町としての基礎を築いたのであった。
sen.e: Moreover, Mitsuhide formed the basis of castle town by giving good administrations such as improvement of flow of Yura-gawa River which had often caused floods until then, and releasing farmers who were impoverished due to repeated floods from Shishisen tax, etc.

sen.j: そのわずか3年後の1582年6月に光秀は本能寺の変を起こし一時天下人になるも、山崎の戦いにおいて豊臣秀吉に敗れ落命し、明智氏は滅亡する。
sen.e: In June 1582 only three years after that, Mitsuhide caused the Honnoji Incident and obtained the top position temporarily, but he was defeated by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and died in the Battle of Yamazaki, and the Akechi clan perished.

sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。

sen.j: 福知山を含む丹波国一体は秀吉の支配下に置かれ、秀吉の家臣の小野木重勝（小野木重次、小野木重勝ともいう）や杉原家次らが、秀吉の命により福智山城城主となり統治するようになる。
sen.e: The whole area of Tanba Province including Fukuchiyama came under Hideyoshi's rule, and Hideyoshi's vassal such as Shigekatsu ONOGI (also called Shigetsugu ONOGI or Shigekatsu ONOGI), Ietsugu SUGIHARA, etc. was ordered to take office as a castellan of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle by Hideyoshi, and ruled the area.

The whole area of Tanba Province including Fukuchiyama came under Hideyoshi's rule, and Hideyoshi's vassals such as Shigekatsu ONOGI (also called Shigetsugu ONOGI or Shigekatsu ONOGI), Ietsugu SUGIHARA, etc. were ordered to take office as steward of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle by Hideyoshi, subsequently ruling the area.

The whole area of Tanba Province including Fukuchiyama came under Hideyoshi's rule, and Hideyoshi's vassals such as Shigekatsu ONOGI (also called Shigetsugu ONOGI or Shigekatsu ONOGI), Ietsugu SUGIHARA, etc. were ordered to take office as steward of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle by Hideyoshi, subsequently ruling the area.

sen.j: 重勝は秀吉の没後、徳川家康と石田三成とが対立すると三成に味方し、1600年（慶長5年）には家康方の細川幽斎が守る田辺城を攻め落城させた（田辺城の戦い）。
sen.e: After Hideyoshi died, Shigekatsu stood on the side of Mitsunari ISHIDA when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA had a conflict with Mitsunari, and in 1600, attacked and conquered the Tanabe-jo Castle protected by Yusai HOSOKAWA standing on the side of Ieyasu (the Battle of Tanabe-jo), but, Shigekatsu who escaped when Mitsunari defeated in the Battle of Sekigahara was pursued and attacked by Tadaoki HOSOKAWA, and killed himself.

After Hideyoshi passed away, Shigekatsu stood by the side of Mitsunari ISHIDA during Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's conflict with Mitsunari. In 1600, he attacked and conquered Tanabe-jo Castle protected by Yusai HOSOKAWA who stood at Ieyasu's side (the Battle of Tanabe-jo). However, Shigekatsu who escaped when Mitsunari was defeated in the Battle of Sekigahara, was pursued and attacked by Tadaoki HOSOKAWA, and subsequently killed himself.

After Hideyoshi passed away, Shigekatsu stood by the side of Mitsunari ISHIDA during Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's conflict with Mitsunari; in 1600, he attacked and conquered Tanabe-jo Castle protected by Yusai HOSOKAWA who stood at Ieyasu's side (the Battle of Tanabe-jo Castle).

tit.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いにおいて徳川家からその功績を認められた有馬豊氏は、横須賀藩から石高を増やしたうえで福知山へと国替を命ぜられた。
sen.e: Toyouji ARIMA whose achievement in the Battle of Sekigahara was recognized by the Tokugawa family was ordered to move to Fukuchiyama from the Yokosuka clan along with an increased yield.
Toyouji ARIMA whose achievement in the Battle of Sekigahara was recognized by the Tokugawa family was given an increased yield and ordered to move to Fukuchiyama from the Yokosuka clan.

sen.j: 有馬豊氏は検地を行い、今でもその名残を残す近代的な町割りを行い城下町を築き上げた。
sen.e: Toyouji ARIMA established a castle town by carrying out a land survey, and also implementing modern uban development of division into towns, and divided towns remain even now.

sen.j: その後有馬豊氏は更に大坂の役においてもその功績を認められ、久留米藩へと国替を命ぜられこの地を去り替わって小堀政一や遠国奉行伏見奉行などによって統治されるようになるが、以降この地を統治していた領主は国替えや改易によってたびたび交代がなされるようになった。
sen.e: Subsequently, after Toyouji ARIMA whose achievement in the Seige of Osaka was also recognized and was ordered to move to the Kurume clan left Fukuchiyama, and instead of him, Masakazu KOBORI, the local magistrate and the Fushimi City magistrate ruled this place; however, thereafter, a ruler of this place was changed often due to transfer or forfeit under the penal rules.
sen.cmt: 改易→forfeit under the penal rules[http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%94%B9%E6%98%93 にて、「改易は刑罰を意味し、武士の身分を剥奪して、所領と城・屋敷を没収すること」との記述より]
sen.e: Subsequently, after Toyouji ARIMA whose achievement in the Seige of Osaka was also recognized and was ordered to move to the Kurume clan left Fukuchiyama. In his stead, the local magistrate, Masakazu KOBORI, and the Fushimi City magistrate, ruled the area; however, thereafter, Fukuchiyama went through a constant change of rulers due to transfer or forfeiture under the penal rules.

Subsequently, after Toyouji ARIMA whose achievement in the Siege of Osaka was also recognized, he was ordered to move to the Kurume clan left Fukuchiyama, and in stead, the local magistrate, Masakazu KOBORI, and the Fushimi City magistrate, ruled the area; however, thereafter, Fukuchiyama went through a constant change of rulers due to transfer or forfeiture under the penal rules.

sen.j: その間1649年（慶安2年）に福知山藩に入った松平忠房が行った検地は、地租改正が行われるまで福知山の土地制度の基準となったためこれを松平検地と呼ばれる。
sen.e: During that time, since the land survey carried out in 1649 by Tadafusa MATSUDAIRA who joined the Fukuchiyama clan acted as a benchmark for the land system in Fukuchiyama until the Land Tax Reform was carried out, it was called Matsudaira's land survey.

During this time, the land survey carried out in 1649 by Tadafusa MATSUDAIRA, who joined the Fukuchiyama clan, acted as a benchmark for the land system in Fukuchiyama until the Land Tax Reform was carried out, and was called Matsudaira's land survey.

sen.j: 1669年（寛文9年）に朽木稙昌が藩政を務めるようになって以後、十三代にわたって朽木家が藩政を務める様になり、藩主が五代目朽木玄綱になると地名を「福智山」から「福知山」に改め、「明智光秀の治水によって水害から救われ、城下町として栄えたのは彼のおかげである」という住民の連署によって御霊神社 (福知山市)に光秀の合祀を許したのであった。
sen.e: After Tanemoto KUTSUKI took on the clan administration in 1669, thirteen generations of the Kutsuki family were in charge of clan administration, and when Totsuna KUTSUKI took office as the fifth domain head, he changed the kanji character of place name from '福智山' to '福知山,' and allowed to enshrine Mitsuhide together in the Goryo-jinja Shrine (Fukuchiyama City) by signatures of residents who 'thanked Mitsuhide AKECHI for prosperity of Fukuchiyama as a castle town by preventing flood damage by his flood prevention works.'

After Tanemoto KUTSUKI took on the clan administration in 1669, thirteen generations of the Kutsuki family were in charge of clan administration, and when Totsuna KUTSUKI took office as the fifth domain head, he changed the kanji character of the name from '福智山' to '福知山,' and allowed enshrinement of Mitsuhide in the Goryo-jinja Shrine (Fukuchiyama City) by residents who 'thanked Mitsuhide AKECHI for the prosperity of Fukuchiyama as a castle town through his flood prevention works.'

After Tanemasa KUTSUKI took on the clan administration in 1669, thirteen generations of the Kutsuki family were in charge of clan administration, and when Totsuna KUTSUKI took office as the fifth domain head, he changed the kanji character of the domain name from '福智山' to '福知山,' and allowed enshrinement of Mitsuhide in the Goryo-jinja Shrine (Fukuchiyama City) by residents who 'thanked Mitsuhide AKECHI for the prosperity of Fukuchiyama as a castle town through his flood prevention works.'

sen.j: 一方このときの福知山藩の財政状態は朽木家二代目朽木稙元を始めとして苦しいもので、その建て直しをはかってたびたび財政改革を行おうとするものの、たびたび百姓による強訴が起きるなど失敗に終わってしまうのであった。
sen.e: On the other hand, as the fiscal situation of the Fukuchiyama clan at that time has been severe since the second domain head of Tanemoto KUTSUKI in the Kutsuki family, the domain head repeatedly challenged fiscal reforms in order to improve the fiscal situation, but these reforms resulted in failure due to frequent riots by farmers.
sen.cmt: 強訴→riot[強訴は「一揆」を意味するので]
sen.e: On the other hand, the financial situation of the Fukuchiyama clan at the time was dire ever since the rule of the second domain head of Tanemoto KUTSUKI in the Kutsuki family. While the domain head repeatedly carried out fiscal reforms in order to improve the situation, these reforms resulted in failure due to frequent riots by farmers.

On the other hand, the financial situation of the Fukuchiyama clan at the time was dire ever since the rule of the second domain head of Tanemoto KUTSUKI in the Kutsuki family, and while the domain head repeatedly carried out fiscal reforms in order to improve the situation, these reforms resulted in failure due to frequent riots by farmers.

sen.e: The riots which started from the Kyoho Famine, and broke out in 1860 were especially massive.

sen.j: このとき日本は日露戦争を控え、京阪神と日本有数の軍港である舞鶴港をつなぐ交通網の普及が急がれたことから、福知山はその中継地点として福知山線と山陰本線の敷設が行われた。
sen.e: At this time, by reason that the expansion of transportation network connecting Keihanshin and Maizuru Port which was one of the major military ports in Japan was an urgent issue in preparation for the Russo-Japanese War, the Fukuchiyama Line and the Sanin Main Line were constructed with setting Fukuchiyama as the connecting point.

At this time, the Fukuchiyama Line and the Sanin Main Line were constructed with Fukuchiyama as a connection. This was due to the fact that expanding the transportation network connecting Keihanshin and Maizuru Port, one of the major military ports in Japan, was an urgent issue in the preparation for the Russo-Japanese War.

sen.e: Fukuchiyama established a sister city relationship with Shimabara City, taking advantage of the event that Tadafusa MATSUDAIRA (domain head of the Shimabara clan) who was the domain head of the Fukuchiyama clan at that time moved to the Shimabara clan (present-day Shimabara City) in 1669.

sen.j: 福知山という地名は明智光秀の城改修の際に名付けられた「福智山」に由来する。
sen.e: The place name of Fukuchiyama originates from 'Fukuchiyama' (described as 福智山 in kanji differently from the current description of 福知山) named when Mitsuhide AKECHI renovated a castle.
sen.cmt: 「福智山」→'Fukuchiyama' (described as 福智山 in kanji differently from the current description of 福知山)[漢字表記での違いを示すため、漢字表記を加え、説明を付しました]

sen.j: 和泉式部の歌「丹波なる 吹風（ふくち）の山の もみじ葉は 散らぬ先より 散るかとぞおもう」から取り、これに明智の「智」の字を当てたという説や、或いは富士山由来の名（別名）によるとの説も存在する。
sen.e: But, some people believe that the place name comes from the poem of Izumi Shikibu saying 'maple leaves in the mountain in Tanba may fall earlier than my expectation due to wind blowing (fukucni in Japanese) to the mountain,' and 'Chi' (智 in kanji) of Akechi (明智 in kanji) was used, or from the name originating from Mt. Fuji (another name of Mt. Fuji).

sen.j: 福智山の「智」は1728年（享保13年）に朽木氏によって「知」の字に改められた。
sen.e: A kanji character of 'Chi' (智 in kanji) of Fukuchiyama (福智山 in kanji) was changed to 'Chi' (知 in kanji) by the Kutsuki clan in 1728.

sen.e: In Old Fukuchiyama City, there are two or more block names such as place names (Aza and Koaza), names of residents' associations, commonly-called names, etc., and the name of residents' association was very complicated because it does not always correspond to a range of city block named differently.

sen.j: かつての福知山は川を利用した水運による流通が盛んで、由良川沿いには港を意味する「津」が付く「天津、高津江、常津」などの地名が数多く存在する。
sen.e: In Fukuchiyama, a distribution through water transportation using a river used to be active, and there are many place names including 'tsu or zu' meaning a port such as 'Amazu, Takatsue and Tsunezu,' along the Yura-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 「津」→'tsu or zu' (津 in kanji)[tsu や zu と読むため、両方を表記し、また、全てのtsu や zu が港を意味しないので、漢字表記も加えました]
sen.e: Distribution using water transportation via a river used to be popular in Fukuchiyama, and there are many place names including 'tsu or zu' which refer to ports, such as 'Amazu, Takatsue and Tsunezu,' along the Yura-gawa River.

Distribution using water transportation via a river used to be popular in Fukuchiyama, and there are many place names including 'tsu' or 'zu' which refer to ports, such as 'Amazu, Takatsue and Tsunezu,' along the Yura-gawa River.

sen.j: 基本的に日本海側気候であり旧三和町を除いて豪雪地帯である。
sen.e: The climate of Fukuchiyama except old Miwa-cho is categorized as a climate peculiar to areas along the Japan Sea, and Fukuchiyama has heavy snowfall.
The climate of Fukuchiyama, except old Miwa-cho, is categorized as peculiar to areas along the Japan Sea, with heavy snowfall.

sen.j: 旧丹後地域（雲原・大江）を除く盆地においては“やまかげ”となり、丹後地方に比較して量は少なめである（平地でも年間4~5日は30cm程度の積雪がみられる）。
sen.e: Since the basin except the old Tango area (Kumobara and Oe) is 'behind a mountain,' the snow depth is comparatively lower than that in the Tango region (the snow depth is about 30 cm for 4 to 5 days in a year even in the flatland).

sen.e: Since sunshine hours become short due to fog in the morning on a clear day and snow cloud in winter, a dark image as shown by the word of 'Sanin' (behind a mountain) cannot be shaked off.

The area has the stigma of being a relatively dark area, true to the name of 'Sanin' (behind a mountain) due to the shortened hours of daylight caused by fog in the morning, and snow clouds in winter.

sen.e: In the flatland (Fukuchiyama Regional Meteorological Observing Station), the average temperature is approximately 14 degrees Celsius, the annual rainfall is approximately 1,500 mm, and the annual sunshine hours are approximately 1,400.

sen.j: 降水量の季節分布としては旧丹後地域では降雪を中心に冬季雨量が多いが、以南では梅雨・台風により夏季雨量のほうが多くなる傾向がある。
sen.e: The seasonal distribution of rainfall shows that the rainfall is high in winter in the old Tango area due to snow, but the rainfall tends to be high in summer in the southern area due to rainy season and typhoons.

sen.j: 盆地内を中心に少量で限られた地域ではあるが、淡水に住む貝の貝殻の化石が出土している。
sen.e: Although small in number from a limited area, some fossil shell of shellfish living in fresh water is found mainly in the basin.
Fossils of fresh water shellfish have been found in small numbers and concentrated in a limited area from within the basin.

sen.j: 貝殻の種類に加えその分布などから、2～30万年前の氷河期には福知山盆地内全てが湖あるいは沼の底であったと考えられている。
sen.e: From the kinds of shell and its distribution, it is believed that the whole area in the Fukuchiyama Basin used to be the bottom of lake or pond in the glacial age about 200 to 300 thousand years ago.
Based on the kinds of shell and their distribution, it is believed that the entire area used to be the bottom of a lake or pond during the Ice Age roughly 200 to 300 thousand years ago.

sen.j: また、各河川流域の調査から、かつて由良川は土師川（竹田川）を介して加古川につながり南下していたと考えられる。
sen.e: According to surveys of watershed areas of each river, it is believed that the Yura-gawa River used to connect to the Kako-gawa River via the Haze-gawa River (Takeda-gawa River), and run southward.

sen.j: これらから、地形の沈降により南下の流れが止まったことで盆地一帯は湖沼を形成、さらなる変化により日本海側への流路ができると湖沼の水位は下がりやがて消滅、現在の市内を流れる由良川、土師川、牧川などに変化していった、という経緯が考えられている。
sen.e: These lead to a process believed that the lake was formed in the whole area of basin since the southward flow stopped due to topographic subsidence, the water level of lake fell when flow channels to the Japan Sea were generated due to further changes, the lake disappeared, and the flow channels turned into the present-day Yura-gawa River, the Haze-gawa River and the Maki-gawa River running in the city.

Based on this, it is believed that the lake was formed through a process whereby the southward flow stopped due to topographic subsidence, causing the water level of the lake to fall when flow channels to the Japan Sea were created due to further changes, resulting in the lake dissapearing. The flow channels then turned into the present-day Yura-gawa River, the Haze-gawa River and the Maki-gawa River running in the city.

Based on this, it is believed that the lake was formed through a process whereby the southward flow stopped due to topographic subsidence, causing the water level of the lake to fall when flow channels to the Japan Sea were created due to further changes, resulting in the lake disappearing; the flow channels then turned into the present-day Yura-gawa River, the Haze-gawa River and the Maki-gawa River running in the city.
sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。

sen.j: 盆地内の河川勾配が非常に緩く、出口付近がボトルネックとなって大雨時に停滞し度々洪水を引き起こす（福知山と由良川）というのは、こういう形成履歴を持つためであろうと考えられる。
sen.e: This kind of forming history is considered to be a reason that floods (Fukuchiyama and Yura-gawa River) are caused frequently because the river water is held up at the time of heavy rain due to very gradual inclination of rivers running in the basin, and the bottleneck caused around the outlet.

This process is considered to be the reason that floods (Fukuchiyama and Yura-gawa River) frequently occur, since the river water is held up during times of heavy rain as a result of the very gradual inclination of rivers running in the basin, and the bottleneck caused around the outlet.

This process is considered to be the reason that floods (Fukuchiyama and Yura-gawa River) frequently occur, since the river water is held up during times of heavy rain as a result of the very gradual inclination of rivers running in the basin, and the bottleneck caused around the outlet.

sen.j: また、これらの名残としては、由良川上流域に当たる船井郡京丹波町安栖里（あせり）周辺の4段にもなる大規模な河岸段丘の存在、市内の長田野（おさだの）の高位段丘面を持つ洪積台地の存在などがある。
sen.e: As relics of these, there exist a large-scale river terrace with 4 layers around Aseri Kyotanba-cho Funai-gun located on the upper reaches of the Yura-gawa River, and a diluvial upland with high terrace surface at Osadano in the city.

Signs of this process still exist, including a large-scale river terrace with 4 layers around Aseri Kyotanba-cho Funai-gun located on the upper reaches of the Yura-gawa River, and a diluvial upland with high terrace surface at Osadano in the city.

Signs of this process still exist, including a large-scale river terrace with four layers around Aseri, Kyotanba-cho in Funai-gun located on the upper reaches of the Yura-gawa River, and a diluvial upland with high terrace surface at Osadano in the city.

sen.j: この地ではかつてさまざまな鉱物が産出されており、特に大江山は金属鉱脈が多く河守鉱山では銅鉱・黄銅鉱・硫化鉱・クロム鉄鉱・銀鉱が、また仏性寺鉱山ではモリブデン（水鉛）が採掘された。

sen.j: かつての由良川の流れは現在の福知山駅周辺にまで流れており、また大雨が降るたび氾濫を起こし周辺の人々や建物に加え農作物などに深刻な被害をもたらす暴れ川であった。
sen.e: The Yura-gawa River used to run to the area around present-day Fukuchiyama Station, and was a violent river causing serious damage to surrounding people, buildings and agricultural products due to floods frequently occurring whenever it rained heavily.

The Yura-gawa River used to run to the area around present-day Fukuchiyama Station. It was a violent river which caused serious damage to the surrounding people, buildings and agricultural products due to floods which frequently occurred whenever it rained heavily.

sen.j: 明智光秀が福知山を統治するようになると、光秀は後に城下町ともなる城に連なる居住地造営と治水のため、長さ1kmにも及ぶ築堤により川筋を大幅に変更したことにより由良川の流れは大幅に改善されたが、それでも洪水は収まらずその後の為政者も治水に尽力を惜しまなかった。
sen.e: When Mitsuhide AKECHI became a ruler of Fukuchiyama, Mitsuhide drastically changed the course of the river by building an embankment as long as 1 km for the purpose of development of residential area continuing into a castle, which became a castle town later, and flood improvement; however, since floods still occurred, subsequent administrators also spared no effort for flood control.

When Mitsuhide AKECHI became the ruler of Fukuchiyama, he drastically changed the course of the river by building an embankment as long as 1 km for the purpose of developing the castle's residential area which later became a castle town, and improved the flow of the river; however, since floods still occurred, subsequent administrators spared no effort towards flood control.

When Mitsuhide AKECHI became the ruler of Fukuchiyama, he drastically changed the course of the river by building an embankment as long as one km for the purpose of developing the castle's residential area which later became a castle town, and improved the flow of the river; however, since floods still occurred, subsequent administrators spared no effort towards flood control.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 彼の築堤の名残として「明智藪」と呼ばれる堤防保護のための藪を今もなお見ることができ、現在もなお行われている堤防築造や国土交通省などによる水位の監視などは彼に始まるものである。
sen.e: There still exists yabu (bushes in English) called 'Akechi-yabu' to protect an embankment as a trace of his building of embankment, and the building of embankment implemented even now and monitoring of water level by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism began from his works.

To this day, there still exists a yabu (bushes in English) known as 'Akechi-yabu' to protect the embankements. Today, the monitoring of water levels by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism all stem from his works.

sen.j: 例えば1896年（明治29年）と1907年（明治40年）に起きた大雨による氾濫は、両者とも同じ堤防が決壊したことにより市街地は2階まで床上浸水し、水が引くまでは屋根の上で生活し移動も船でという状況だった。
sen.e: For example, when the same embankment was broken by two floods caused in 1896 and 1907 due to heavy rain, the urban area was flooded above floor level on the second floor, and people lived on the roof and moved by boat until flood waters receded.

For example, when the same embankment broke down by two floods in 1896 and 1907 due to heavy rain, the urban area was flooded above floor level on the second floor. People had to live on the roofs of their houses, and moved by boat until flood waters receded.

sen.e: In the latter, the damage was smaller than that in the former with that lesson's being learned, but, the urban area was driven into the almost shattered situation.
While the damage was smaller than those before them, despite this, the area was almost completely destroyed.

sen.j: 同時に由良川に架かる橋であった音無瀬橋も2度流され、その費用補填のために大人4厘、子供2厘、牛馬は5厘という通行料を徴収したほどでもあった。
sen.e: Since the Otonase-bashi Bridge over the Yura-gawa River was also washed away twice, tolls of 4 rin (rin is an old auxiliary currency used until 1953; 1 rin is equivalent to 0.001 yen) for adults, 2 rin for children and 5 rin for cattle were collected to make up for the repair cost.

sen.j: 加えて1953年（昭和28年）9月25日の昭和28年台風第13号を起因とする由良川の氾濫は、最高水位が7.8mにもなる大量の水が福知山市街地全域を水浸しにし、市内で死者は約40名、負傷者は約900名、家屋全壊、半壊ともに1100戸以上、床上浸水においては5300戸以上もの被害をもたらした。
sen.e: In addition, in the overflow of the Yura-gawa River caused on September 25, 1953 by typhoon No. 13 in 1953 (28th year of the Showa Period), a large volume of water with the floodmark as high as 7.8 m covered the entire urban area of Fukuchiyama, and caused damage of approximately 940 people casualties including approximately 40 deaths, at least 1,100 demolished and partially-destroyed houses, and at least 5,300 houses flooded above floor level.

In addition, the overflow of the Yura-gawa River caused on September 25, 1953 by typhoon No. 13 in 1953 (28th year of the Showa Period), resulting in a large volume of water with a floodmark as high as 7.8 m covering the entire urban area of Fukuchiyama, resulting in approximately 940 casualties including approximately 40 deaths, and at least 1,100 demolished and partially-destroyed houses, with at least 5,300 houses flooded above floor level.

In addition, the overflow of the Yura-gawa River caused on September 25, 1953 by typhoon No.13 in 1953 (twentieth year of the Showa period), resulting in a large volume of water with a floodmark as high as 7.8 m covering the entire urban area of Fukuchiyama, resulting in approximately 940 casualties including approximately 40 deaths, and at least 1,100 demolished and partially-destroyed houses, with at least 5,300 houses flooded above floor level.

sen.j: この台風のときの被害は地元では28水（28災とも）として知られ、このときの水位は福知山と水害を伝える資料として市内御霊公園にはそれを示す標識が設置されている。
sen.e: The damage caused by this typhoon is known by local residents as 28 flood (28 damage), and a signboard showing the water level at this time is established in the Goryo Park in the city as materials informing Fukuchiyama and flood damage.

sen.j: その恐ろしさや先人の築いた堤防のありがたさを後世に伝えるため、御霊神社 (福知山市)境内には全国唯一の堤防そのものを御神体とする堤防神社が建立されており、1931年（昭和6年）以降の毎年8月15日には、神輿が市内を巡回する「堤防祭り」が行われている。
sen.e: In order to hand down the threat and thank for embankment built by predecessors to posterity, the one and only Teibo-jinja Shrine in Japan with the embankment itself as a divine symbol is built on the premise of Goryo-jinja Shrine, and on August 15 of every year since 1931, the 'Teibo Matsuri (embankment festival)' is held, in which a portable shrine makes a tour in the city.

The Teibo-jinja Shrine in Japan was built on the premise of Goryo-jinja Shrine, with the embankment itself a divine symbol, in order to honor those predecessors who setup the embankment, as well as a sign to remind others of the dangers caused by the floods. On August 15 of every year since 1931, the 'Teibo Matsuri (embankment festival)' is held, in which a portable shrine tours the city.

The Teibo-jinja Shrine in Japan was built on the premise of Goryo-jinja Shrine (Fukuchiyama City), with the embankment itself a divine symbol, in order to honor those predecessors who setup the embankment, as well as a sign to remind others of the dangers caused by the floods, and on August 15 of every year since 1931, the 'Teibo Matsuri' (embankment festival) is held, in which a portable shrine tours the city.

sen.j: しかし由良川は国土交通大臣が国民経済上特に重要な河川などに対して指定する一級水系に指定されているとおり、市内に供給される浄水場の原水や農業用水としては勿論のこと、今では市民の手による鮎や鮭の稚魚の放流といったイベントが開かれるなど、市民の生活には欠くことのできない川である。
sen.e: However, the Yura-gawa River is designated as one of the first class rivers which are designated by the Minister of Land, Infrastructure, Transportation and Tourism for rivers especially important in the national economy, and is an essential river for a citizens' life nowadays because its water is used as raw water at a purification plant to supply water to the city and as agricultural water, and various events such as release of young sweetfish and salmon by citizens are held.

However, the Yura-gawa River is designated as a first class river, a classification designated by the Minister of Land, Infrastructure, Transportation and Tourism indicating rivers which are especially important to the national economy. These days, the river is essential to people's lives, as it's water is used to supply water to the city via a purification plant for agriculture. Various events, such as the release of young sweetfish and salmon are also held by citizens at the river as well.

sen.j: 福知山線や山陰本線は、国内有数の軍港である舞鶴港と京阪神をつなぐ鉄道として軍事的理由によって整備促進されたという側面もあり、その中継地点である福知山は軍事都市としても栄えたといえる。
sen.e: Because the Fukuchiyama Line and the Sanin Main Line were developed and promoted by a military reason as railroads connecting Maizuru Port, one of the best military port in Japan, and Keihanshin, Fukuchiyama, connecting point of those Lines, was also flourished as a military city.

sen.e: During the final days of the Pacific War, an air base called 'Isa Airport' for the Old Japanese Military, the Imperial Japanese Navy, existed, and the runway ran from Maeda in the city to Toda across Isa, and measured up to approximately 1,700 m long.

sen.e: However, when the war was over, as local farmers removed concrete from the runway by themselves, and restored it to the agricultural land, the runway at that time does not exist now; however, a storage of goods and antiaircraft gun exists around it, and were the target of attack by machine-gunning from the U.S. military.

sen.j: 盆地という山々に囲まれた閉鎖的な地形をしているにもかかわらず、福知山周辺地域では少なくとも縄文時代から人が住んでいたことなどから古くから道路が整備され、日本海沿岸、山陰地方と京阪神方面をつなぐ交通の要所として栄えた市である。
sen.e: Although the area around Fukuchiyama has a topographically closed feature of basin surrounded by mountains, roads were developed from a long time ago because people lived in this area at least from the Jomon Period, and Fukuchiyama City was flourished as an important place for transportation connecting areas along the Japan Sea and in the Sanin Region with Keihanshin.

Although the area around Fukuchiyama has a basin which is topographically closed and surrounded by mountains, it's roads were developed long ago by people who have lived in this area from at least the Jomon Period, allowing Fukuchiyama City to flourish as an important place for transportation connecting areas along the Japan Sea and in the Sanin Region with Keihanshin.

sen.j: 百人一首の中の小式部内侍が歌った「おほえ山 いくの（生野）の道の遠ければ まだふみも見ず 天橋立」の歌枕として登場する生野は福知山市内の地名であるが、このことからその福知山と交通の歴史の深さを知ることが出来る。
sen.e: Ikuno, which appears in the beginning of one of Hyakunin Isshu (one hundred waka poems by one hundred poets) composed by Koshikibu no Naishi saying 'the road going to Ikuno over Oe-yama Mountain is so far that I have not set foot on Amanohashidate and seen any letter from my mother yet,' is a place name in Fukuchiyama City, and this poem shows a long history of relationship between Fukuchiyama and transportation.
sen.cmt: 「おほえ山 いくの（生野）の道の遠ければ まだふみも見ず 天橋立」→the Road going to Ikuno over Oe-yama Mountain is so far that I have not set foot on Amanohashidate and seen a letter from my mother yet[この句は、『大江山を越えて生野へと向かう道のりは遠いので、まだ母のいる天の橋立の地を踏んだこともありませんし、母からの手紙もまだ見ていません』との意味である[http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%BC%8F%E9%83%A8%E5%86%85%E4%BE%8D]]
sen.e: Ikuno, which appears in the beginning of one of the Hyakunin Isshu (one hundred waka poems by one hundred poets) was composed by Koshikibu no Naishi saying 'the road going to Ikuno over Oe-yama Mountain is so far that I have not set foot on Amanohashidate and seen any letter from my mother yet,' and is a place name in Fukuchiyama City; this poem illustrates the long relationship between Fukuchiyama and transportation.

Ikuno, which appears in the beginning of one of the Hyakunin Isshu (one hundred waka poems by one hundred poets) was composed by Koshikibu no Naishi saying 'The road going over the Oe-yama mountain range and via Ikuno is so far that I have not set foot on Ama no Hashidate or seen a letter from my mother yet,' and is a place name in Fukuchiyama City; this poem illustrates the long relationship between Fukuchiyama and transportation.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）ごろから京阪神から日本海側へつながる高速道路である舞鶴若狭自動車道もようやく整備され、鉄道に加え交通の要（かなめ）の役割を果たす道路が交わる北近畿の交通の中心となっている。
sen.e: In around 1987, the development of Maizuru Wakasa Express Way, express way connecting Keihanshin with areas along the Japan Sea, has finally started, and Fukuchiyama where roads playing a role as a key to transportation intersect as well as railroad has been a hub of transportation in Kitakinki.

Around 1987, the development of Maizuru Wakasa Express Way, an express way connecting Keihanshin with areas along the Japan Sea, finally commenced, making the roads in Fukuchiyama to play a central role in transportation in Kitakinki, together with the railroads.

sen.e: Since Mitsuhide AKECHI was the first castellan of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle, and gave good administration, many things and events which are related to the Akechi clan and Mitsuhide can be seen everywhere in Fukuchiyama City although the length of his reign was short.

Mitsuhide AKECHI was the first castellan of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle, and many events and items around Fukuchiyama City are related to the Akechi clan and Mitsuhide, despite the short length of his rule, due to the positive reputation of his administration.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）にはグンゼの事務所が、翌年には工場が置かれたほどで、生産された生糸は丹後ちりめんや西陣織の原材料としてだけでなく海外への輸出用としても生産され、養蚕業は当時の福知山を支える地場産業であった。
sen.e: Because Gunze Ltd. located its business office in 1928, and its plant in 1929, and raw silk was produced not only as raw materials of Tango chirimen (silk crepe) and Nishijin Textile but also for export, the sericulture was the local industry supporting Fukuchiyama in those days.

sen.j: しかし第二次世界大戦になると食糧不足解消のため、桑畑をサツマイモ畑に転作したことや、糸そのものの価格の低下、ナイロンなどの化学繊維の出現や養蚕農家の後継者不足と高齢化などのさまざまな理由によって養蚕業の衰退を招き、これらをきっかけにほとんどの養蚕農家や製糸業者は廃業に追い込まれた。
sen.e: However, when the World War II broke out, the sericulture declined due to various reasons such as change of crop from mulberry to sweet potato as countermeasure for food shortages, price reduction of yarn itself, appearance of chemical fibers such as nylon fibers, lack of successors in silk-raising farmers, aging of silk-raising farmers, etc., and this decline drove most silk-raising farmers and yarn-making companies into closedown.

However, when the World War II broke out, sericulture declined due to various reasons, including changes in crop (from mulberry to sweet potato) to prevent food shortages, price reduction of yarn itself, the appearance of chemical fibers such as nylon fibers, lack of successors in silk-raising farmers, aging of silk-raising farmers, etc., all factors leading to a decline and the eventual closeout by silk-raising farmers and yarn-making companies.

sen.j: それでも生き残った数少ない業者も業界の激しい値下げ競争により、生産拠点を人件費が安い海外へ移さざるを得なくなったことがさらに追い討ちをかけ、その業者の一つであったグンゼも2001年9月に福知山から撤退するなど、特産品であった生糸も現在は養蚕農家を市内大江町に一軒だけ残すのみとなり、上述の藍同様にほぼ完全に福知山から姿を消した。
sen.e: The fact that, due to the severe price-cutting war, very few surviving companies had to shift their production bases to other countries where the personnel expense was lower, enhanced the decline, and with respect to raw silk which was the specialty goods of Fukuchiyama, only one silk-raising farmer remains now in Oe-machi in the city due to a reason that Gunze, one of such companies, withdrew from Fukuchiyama in September 2001, and other reasons, and then, raw silk disappeared almost completely from Fukuchiyama as in the aforementioned case of indigo.

sen.j: 福知山市は周辺自治体では人口の減少が進む中少なくとも平成の合併まではほぼ横ばいに近い程度の人口増加を続けてきた市である。
sen.e: The Fukuchiyama City's population has been increased as slightly as unchanged until the municipal merger in Heisei while the population has decreased in surrounding municipalities.
Fukuchiyama City's population experienced an increase which was close to being relatively unchanged until the municipal merger in Heisei, while the population decreased in surrounding municipalities.
Fukuchiyama City's population experienced an increase which was close to being relatively unchanged until the municipal merger in Heisei, while the population decreased in surrounding municipalities.

sen.j: しかし国勢調査によると、1985年（昭和60年）の老齢人口比率は11.7%だったのに対して1999年（平成11年）には18.4%にまで上昇しており高齢化が進行している市でもある。
sen.e: However, according to the population census, the ratio of ageing population was 11.7% in 1985, but increased to 18.4% in 1999, which shows that Fukuchiyama is an aging city.
However, according to the population census, the ratio of the aging population was 11.7% in 1985, but increased to 18.4% in 1999, showing that Fukuchiyama is an aging city.
However, according to the population census, the ratio of the aging population was 11.7% in 1985, but increased to 18.4% in 1999, showing that Fukuchiyama is an aging city.

sen.j: 福知山市全域の電力は関西電力より供給されている。
sen.e: Gas is provided to the whole area in Fukuchiyama City by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc.
Gas is provided to the whole area in Fukuchiyama City by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc.
Electricity is provided to the whole area in Fukuchiyama City by the Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc.

sen.j: 市街地周辺のガスは、由良川とその支流である土師川より西は市の公営企業（福知山市ガス水道部）、以東の長田野工業団地周辺は株式会社長田野ガスセンターが供給する天然ガス（一部区域は公営企業によるプロパンガス）による都市ガスとなっている。
sen.e: Gas supplied to areas around the urban area is city gas by natural gas which is supplied to the areas to the west of Yura-gawa River and its tributary, Haze-gawa River, by the public company of the city (Fukuchiyama City & Gas Department Business Division), and to the area around the Osadano Industrial Park to the east of such rivers by Osadano Gas Center (or by propane gas which is supplied to some district in this area by a public company).

Gas supplied to urban areas is natural gas supplied to areas west of Yura-gawa River and its tributary, Haze-gawa River, by the public company of the city (Fukuchiyama City & Gas Department Business Division), and to areas around the Osadano Industrial Park to the east of such rivers by Osadano Gas Center (or by propane gas which is supplied to some district in this area by a public company).

Gas supplied to urban areas is natural gas supplied to areas west of the Yura-gawa River and its tributary, Haze-gawa River, by the public company of the city (Fukuchiyama City & Gas Department Business Division), and to areas around the Osadano Industrial Park to the east of such rivers by Osadano Gas Center (or by propane gas which is supplied to some district in this area by a public company).
sen.cmt: "Yura-gawa River"→"the Yura-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: しかし、供給困難な山間部や市街地においても供給区域でない地域があり、ボンベによるプロパンガスを使用している世帯も少なくない。
sen.e: However, in the mountainous area with difficulties in supply, and in some parts in the service area even in the urgan area, not a few households use propane gas with cylinders.
However, in mountainous regions which face supply difficulties, and even some urban areas, there are some households which use cylinders of propane gas.
However, in mountainous regions which face supply difficulties, and even some urban areas, there are some households which use cylinders of propane gas.

sen.j: 福知山は山々に囲まれているため、由良川、土師川、牧川などの川の水資源が比較的豊富で福知山市の水道代は近畿の194ある市町村の中で20番目に安い。
sen.e: As Fukuchiyama is surrounded by mountains, the water resources from rivers such as Yura-gawa River, Haze-gawa River and Maki-gawa River are comparatively rich, and the water rate in Fukuchiyama City is the 20th cheapest one among 194 municipalities in Kinki.

As Fukuchiyama is surrounded by mountains, water resources from rivers such as the Yura-gawa River, Haze-gawa River and Maki-gawa River are comparatively rich, with the cost of water foor Fukuchiyama City being among the 20th cheapest among 194 municipalities in Kinki.

As Fukuchiyama is surrounded by mountains, water resources from rivers such as the Yura-gawa River, Haze-gawa River and Maki-gawa River are comparatively rich, with the cost of water for Fukuchiyama City being among the twentieth cheapest among 194 municipalities in Kinki.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: それら水の供給は市の公営企業（福知山市ガス水道部）の上水道および簡易水道より供給される。
sen.e: The water is supplied through city water system and simple water-supply system by the public company of the city (Fukuchiyama City Gas & Water Department Business Division).
The water is supplied through the city water system and simple water-supply system by the public company of the city (Fukuchiyama City Gas & Water Department Business Division).
The water is supplied through the city water system and simple water-supply system by the public company of the city (Fukuchiyama City Gas & Water Department Business Division).

sen.j: 市街地周辺の簡易水道については、順次上水道への統合計画が進められている。
sen.e: With respect to the simple water-supply system to areas around the urban area, a plan for gradual integration into the city water system moves ahead.
With respect to the simple water-supply system to areas surrounding the urban region, a plan is being pushed forward to gradually integrate the city water system.
With respect to the simple water-supply system to areas surrounding the urban region, a plan is being pushed forward to gradually integrate the city water system.

sen.j: 一方、下水については浸水被害の歴史から比較的早くから整備されて来ており、旧福知山市域においては80%の下水道普及率（浄化槽を含む水洗化率は92%）があった。
sen.e: On the otherr hand, a sewerage system has been developed comparatively from early on because of a history of flood damage, and the development rate of sewerage was 80% in the old Fukuchiyama City area (the usage rate of flush toilet including septic tank was 92%).

On the other hand, owing to it's history of flood damage, the city developed a sewage system relatively early, covering roughly 80% of the old Fukuchiyama City area (the usage rate of flush toilet including septic tank was 92%).

On the other hand, owing to its history of flood damage, the city developed a sewage system relatively early, covering roughly 80% of the old Fukuchiyama City area (the usage rate of flush toilet including septic tank was 92%).

sen.j: 旧市街地についてはこの理由により、内水排除を目的に雨水汚水の合流式となっている。
sen.e: For this reason, a sewerage system combining rainwater and sewer is adopted for the purpose of drainage behind levee in the old urban area.
sen.cmt: 内水排除→drainage behine levee[PDCI for Window-Eijiro81]
sen.e: For this reason, a sewage system combining rainwater and sewers was adopted to act as drainage behind levees in the old urban area.
For this reason, a sewage system combining rainwater and sewers was adopted to act as drainage behind levees in the old urban area.

sen.j: 市のゴミ処理は、市内牧に所在する環境パークにての焼却、埋め立て処理、リサイクルとなっている。
sen.e: In Fukchiyama City, garbage is disposed of through incineration at the Environmental Park located in Maki in the city, landfill and recycling.
In Fukchiyama City, garbage is disposed through incineration, landfill and recycling at the Environmental Park located in Maki in the city.
In Fukuchiyama City, garbage is disposed through incineration, landfill and recycling at the Environmental Park located in Maki in the city.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 収集されるゴミは、燃やすごみ・燃やさないごみ・プラスチック製容器包装類・資源ごみ（空き缶、空きビン、紙パック、ペットボトル）・蛍光管で、前3種は有料専用袋の使用、また各種の分別が求められる。
sen.e: Garbage subject to burnable one, non-burnable one, plastic containers and packages, recyclable one (empty cans, empty bottles, paper containers and packages, and plastic bottles) and fluorescent lamps are collected, and the use of specific paid garbage bags for the first three categories, and the of garbage according to each category are required.
sen.cmt: 燃やす→burnable[http://www.city.fukuchiyama.kyoto.jp/topics/guide/pdf/1/1_mozi08.pdf(福知山市のWebサイトのトップページ、Another Language、Fukuchiyama living guide;以下同じ）]燃やさない→non-burnable[http://www.city.fukuchiyama.kyoto.jp/topics/guide/pdf/1/1_mozi08.pdf]資源ごみ→recyclable wastes[http://www.city.fukuchiyama.kyoto.jp/topics/guide/pdf/1/1_mozi08.pdf]紙パック→paper containers and packages[http://www.city.fukuchiyama.kyoto.jp/topics/guide/pdf/1/1_mozi08.pdf]専用袋→specific garbage bags[http://www.city.fukuchiyama.kyoto.jp/topics/guide/pdf/1/1_mozi08.pdf]
sen.e: Garbage which is burnable, non-burnable, or plastic containers and packages, recyclables (empty cans, empty bottles, paper containers and packages, and plastic bottles) and fluorescent lamps are collected, with the use of specific paid garbage bags for the first three categories, and seperation of garbage according to each category being required.

Garbage which is burnable, non-burnable, or plastic containers and packages, recyclables (empty cans, empty bottles, paper containers and packages, and plastic bottles) and fluorescent lamps are collected, with the use of specific paid garbage bags for the first three categories, and separation of garbage according to each category being required.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: また粗大ゴミ・特定家庭用機器再商品化法・事業所のゴミは持込みとなっている。
sen.e: Large garbage, electronic under the Specific Household Appliance Recycling Act and wastes discharged from business offices have to be brought in.
sen.cmt: 特定家庭用機器再商品化法→the Specific Household Applicance Recycling Act[PDCI for Window-Eijiro81] 文章として、「特定家庭用機器商品化法」自身を持込むのではなくこの法に基づく家電ごみを持込むので、左記のとおり英訳しました。
sen.e: Large garbage, electronic under the Specific Household Appliance Recycling Act and wastes discharged from business offices have to be brought in.
Large garbage, electronic under the Specific Household Appliance Recycling Act and wastes discharged from business offices have to be brought in.

sen.j: 「燃やすこみ」とされるもの以外は燃やせないタイプの焼却炉であり、現在の埋め立て用地は十数年もすればなくなってしまうため新たな埋め立て用地の確保が問題点となっている。
sen.e: An incinerator for non-burnable garbage is used for garbage other than the burnable garbage, and as the current site for landfill will become unavailable in a little over ten years, the issue is to secure a new site for landfill.

An incinerator for non-burnable garbage is used for garbage other than burnable garbage, and as the current site for landfill will become unavailable in a little over ten years, the current issue is to secure a new landfill site.

sen.j: 本庁および平成の市町村合併以前の各町単位に3つの支所を設けている。
sen.e: The main office, and three branch offices per town before the municipal merger in Heisei are established.
The main office, and three branch offices per town before the municipal merger in Heisei were established.
The main office, and three branch offices per town before the municipal merger in Heisei were established.

sen.j: 夜久野支所以外は旧庁舎におかれている。
sen.e: Branches other than the Yakuno Branch are located in the old government office.
Branches other than the Yakuno Branch are located in the old government office.
Branches other than the Yakuno Branch are located in the old government office.

sen.j: 福知山市に所在する警察署は福知山警察署一つのみである。
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Police Station is the only police station located in Fukuchiyama City.
Fukuchiyama Police Station is the only police station located in Fukuchiyama City.
Fukuchiyama Police Station is the only police station located in Fukuchiyama City.

sen.j: 2005年の市町村合併以前は、三和町 (京都府)、大江町 (京都府)、夜久野町と3つの町も同時管轄していたが、合併に伴い現在は福知山市のみの管轄となった。
sen.e: Before the municipal merger in 2005, the Police Station had jurisdiction over three towns of Miwa-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), Oe-cho (Kyoto-Prefecture) and Yakuno-cho collectively, but came to have jurisdiction over only Fukuchiyama City along with the merger.

Before the municipal merger in 2005, the Police Station had jurisdiction over three towns of Miwa-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), Oe-cho (Kyoto-Prefecture) and Yakuno-cho collectively, but with the merger, their jurisdiction was limited to only only Fukuchiyama City.

Before the municipal merger in 2005, the Police Station had jurisdiction over three towns of Miwa-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), Oe-cho (Kyoto-Prefecture) and Yakuno-cho collectively, but with the merger, their jurisdiction was limited to only Fukuchiyama City.

sen.j: 福知山市の消防団は地域ごとに6つのブロック分けがなされており、その中に計29の分団が存在している。
